function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Integration of COVID-19 identification systems into wearables may lead to a false sense of security and reduced adherence to other preventive measures","Impact":"Increased risk of disease spread and resurgence due to reduced vigilance","Mitigation":"Comprehensive education on the limitations of wearables and reinforcement of the importance of other preventive measures","Technologies":"Educational apps and campaigns, augmented reality for virtual training","People":"Public and individuals relying solely on wearables for COVID-19 detection","Owner":"Health authorities, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Reliance on AI-based diagnosis for contagious diseases may lead to algorithmic biases and inaccurate identification","Impact":"Misdiagnosis, delayed treatment, and potential spread of the disease","Mitigation":"Regular auditing and validation of the AI algorithms, diversity in training data, and human oversight in decision-making","Technologies":"AI auditing tools, diverse data collection methods, human-in-the-loop AI systems","People":"Patients, healthcare providers, and researchers developing AI solutions","Owner":"Regulatory bodies, research institutions, and healthcare organizations"},{"Description":"Privacy concerns and data security risks associated with the collection and transmission of sensitive health data from wearables to cloud systems","Impact":"Potential data breaches, unauthorized access to personal health information, and misuse of sensitive data","Mitigation":"Encryption of data during transmission, strict access controls, and compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR and HIPAA","Technologies":"End-to-end encryption, blockchain for secure data storage, access management tools","People":"Wearable users, data scientists, and cybersecurity professionals","Owner":"Wearable manufacturers, cloud service providers, and data protection authorities"}]}
